sen.j: 余延年（よ えんねん、 延享3年（1746年） – 文政2年4月19日 (旧暦)（1819年5月12日））は、江戸時代中期から後期の日本の篆刻家である。
sen.e: Ennen YO (1746 - May 12, 1819) was a Tenkoku artist (a carver who carved Chinese characters in the special, Tensho, style) who lived in Japan from the middle to the latter half of the Edo period.
Ennen YO (1746 - May 12, 1819) was a Tenkoku artist (a carver who carved Chinese characters in the special, Tensho, style) who lived in Japan from the middle to the latter half of the Edo period.
Ennen YO (1746 - May 12, 1819) was a Tenkoku artist (a carver who carved Chinese characters in the special, Tensho, style) who lived in Japan from the middle to the latter half of the Edo period.
His real family name was Yamaguchi.
His real family name was Yamaguchi.
His real family name was Yamaguchi.

sen.j: 韓国の余璋王の後裔であることから修して余と称している。
sen.e: He used YO (余) because he was a descendent of Yosho O (Prince Yosho) (余璋王) of Korea.
He used YO (余) because he was a descendent of Yosho O (Prince Yosho) (余璋王) of Korea.
He used YO (余) because he was a descendent of Prince Yosho of Korea.
sen.cmt: Yosho O (余璋王)削除しました。

sen.j: 字を千秋または君寿、号 (称号)は墨山・魯台・風塵道人等がある。
sen.e: He was also called Senshu, and used Bokuzan, Rodai, or Hujindojin as the title for his profession.
sen.cmt: 千秋、君寿、墨山・魯台・風塵道人： 読み方不明
sen.e: He was also called Senshu, and used Bokuzan, Rodai, or Hujindojin as the title for his profession.
He was also called Senshu, and used Bokuzan, Rodai, or Hujindojin as the title for his profession.
He was commonly called Kuroemon.
He was commonly called Kuroemon.
He was commonly called Kuroemon.
He came from Chita County, Owari Province.
He came from Chita County, Owari Province.
He came from Chita County, Owari Province.
Summary of his personal history
Summary of his personal history
Summary of his personal history

sen.j: 尾張知多郡大高に住んだ。
sen.e: He lived in Otaka, Chita County, Owari Province.
He lived in Otaka, Chita County, Owari Province.
He lived in Otaka, Chita County, Owari Province.

sen.j: 壮年になって篆刻に懲り、
sen.e: Reaching manhood, he became passionate for carving Tensho-style Chinese characters.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Reaching manhood, he became passionate for carving Tensho-style Chinese characters.
Reaching manhood, he became passionate for carving Tensho-style Chinese characters.

sen.j: 京都に遊学して高芙蓉に入門し技を習得した。
sen.e: Then he went to Kyoto to study under Fuyo KO, mastering the carving method.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Then he went to Kyoto to study under Fuyo KO, mastering the carving method.
Then he went to Kyoto to study under Fuyo KO, mastering the carving method.

sen.j: 左大臣二条斉信に印を納め、成修処士の号を賜った。
sen.e: He had his In (an object on top of which a seal pattern has been carved) purchased by Narinobu NIJO at the position of Minister of the Left and was awarded the title of Seishushoshi.
sen.cmt: 成修処士： 読み方不明
sen.e: He had his In (an object on top of which a seal pattern has been carved) purchased by Narinobu NIJO at the position of Minister of the Left and was awarded the title of Seishushoshi.
He had his In (an object on top of which a seal pattern has been carved) purchased by Narinobu NIJO at the position of Minister of the Left and was awarded the title of Seishushoshi.

sen.j: また増山雪斎に画法を学び、元明の文人画に私淑。
sen.e: He also learned painting from Sessai MASHIYAMA, and was strongly attracted by literati paintings in the Gen and Min era in China.
He also learned painting from Sessai MASHIYAMA, and was strongly attracted by literati paintings in the Gen and Min era in China.
He also learned painting from Sessai MASHIYAMA, and was strongly attracted by literati paintings in the Gen and Min era in China.
He was good at painting orchid and bamboos.
He was good at painting orchid and bamboos.
He was good at painting orchid and bamboos.

sen.j: 印譜に『印鐫』があり、『宣和集古印史』を模刻した。
sen.e: He published "Insen," an Inpu (a compilation of seal marks), and restored "Senwa-Shukoin-shi (liberally, ancient seal marks collected in Senwa era in China."
sen.cmt: 宣和集古印史： 読み方不明
sen.e: He published "Insen," an Inpu (a compilation of seal marks), and restored "Senwa-Shukoin-shi (liberally, ancient seal marks collected in Senwa era in China."
He published "Insen," an Inpu (a compilation of seal marks), and restored "Senwa-Shukoin-shi" (liberally, ancient seal marks collected in Senwa era in China).
sen.cmt: "の位置を訂正しました。)補足しました。

sen.j: また随筆に『風塵随筆』がある。
sen.e: He wrote "Fujin Zuihitsu (Literally, wind dust essay)," an essay.
He wrote "Fujin Zuihitsu (Literally, wind dust essay)," an essay.
He wrote "Fujin Zuihitsu" (Literally, wind dust essay), an essay.
He was 74 years old when he died.
He was 74 years old when he died.

His grave is located in Shunko-in Temple.
